note_tweet.text:
Adina Moshe (72) is an aspiringly courageous woman. 
She was abducted from her safe room on 7.10 where she hid with her husband. Before being dragged by two terrorists, she managed to see how they shot her husband point blank. He blew her a kiss before he died.
Her abductor snatched her jewellery, a young man on the street took her glasses. She couldn’t see her whole time there. 
She was taken to a tunnel along other hostages. She recalls how they decided to pass the time by each giving a lecture on his own field of expertise. Alex Dancyg, a renowned historian, spoke about the holocaust, the group asked him to stop as they felt identification.
Adina decided to negotiate with the guards. When 5-year-old Emilia Aloni couldn’t stop crying of fear from their weapons, Adina approached the head guard and explained that this group of old hostages wouldn’t pose a risk and asked him to lower the weapons down as the child is frightened. He agreed. 
A few time during her weeks there, head of Hamas in Gaza, Sinwar, was there. He entered their room and - in Hebrew- asked how they were. The group didn’t answer. 
When she was told she is being released, Adina argued with the guards and to let other hostages, in worse condition to go home. They declined.
She recalls the harrowing moments of release, when hundreds of Gazans threw rocks at the Red Cross car which took them to Egypt. 
I won’t ever get out of it. She told @N12News .

BREAKING: After careful examination of gaza journalists and social media accounts, with the help of @mishtal s research helping me deepen mine, here are the Gaza journalists casualties:
Out of 111, 85 are VERIFIED TERRORISTS, and 5 were killed alongside other VERIFIED TERRORISTS. https://t.co/iyP4kqieL5

This is a sensitive topic, and I don't underestimate the lives lost in this war. 

But, despite international media claims of Israel targeting journalists in Gaza, the facts are that Israel doesn't target journalists to silence them.

IDF didn't disproportionately kill… https://t.co/Gv2aArkbM5 https://t.co/5sETuT5nL0

note_tweet.text:
This is a sensitive topic, and I don't underestimate the lives lost in this war. 

But, despite international media claims of Israel targeting journalists in Gaza, the facts are that Israel doesn't target journalists to silence them.

IDF didn't disproportionately kill non-terrorist journalists.

According to @mishtal research, 85 of the "journalists" killed in Gaza were active terrorists affiliated with Hamas or other terror organizations in Gaza. Another 5 "journalists" were killed while being close to other terrorists who were eliminated.

For example, the "journalist" Maztapa Taria who was killed alongside the "journalist" Hamza al-Dahdo, who according to documents found by the IDF in Gaza, both belonged to the terrorist organizations in Gaza. 

or the journalists Muhammad Mater, Anas Abu Shamla and Montaser al-Sawaf - all belong to the terrorist organization Hamas. All these are just examples of "journalists" killed in Gaza.

Only 19% of the killed journalists were not proven to be terrorists, and the circumstances of their deaths were not precisely determined. In any war, circumstances may become clear in the future, and sometimes journalists die in tragic circumstances

While in  Israel has press freedom and liberal democracy, allowing any journalist visiting Israel to speak freely, And every journalist who has been in Israel will testify to that. in Gaza, controlled by the fundamentalist Islamic terror organization Hamas, has no press freedom at all.

Every war is terrible, and the current conflict in Gaza is especially dire. As part of their military strategy, Hamas uses civilians as human shields, both in combat and as shields for their terror infrastructure and rocket launchers.

As a result, despite the IDF's immense efforts, civilians continuously suffer. Reports from Gaza on casualty numbers, IDF airstrikes, and fighting between IDF soldiers and Hamas are constantly quoted by international media, but verifying these claims is challenging, and many have been proven entirely false.

In Gaza, there are no journalists who can expose the truth about these numbers and reports. True journalists working in Gaza cannot reveal that, for example, in an airstrike, civilians were not killed, only Hamas militants were.

If a Gaza journalist dares to tell the truth about the number of terrorists killed, Hamas will kill them immediately them.
None of the real journalists in Gaza can tell the truth.

The truth is one of the casualties of war, so it's crucial to expose the journey of lies and manipulation by the terror organization Hamas.

Very few journalists in Gaza are genuine journalists, and even they can't tell the truth due to the dictatorial and terrorist rule in Gaza. The rest of the "journalists" in Gaza are not journalists but terrorists collaborating with Hamas.

It's time to understand that most journalists in Gaza are #TerroristsNotJournalists. And those who are real  journalists do not tell the truth.

A "press" vest, anyone can buy at "Ali Express", but not everyone who wears a press vest is a journalist.
#HamasislSIS #TerroristsNotJournalists

He was also a talented landscaper, car mechanic, musician, and DJ. 

May Hayim’s memory forever be a blessing.

note_tweet.text:
The combatant-to-civilian death ratio in this war is unprecedented. 

I’ll explain: The international media regularly quotes Hamas claims that around 25,000 people have been killed in Gaza. They of course do not differentiate between combatants and civilians. 

If we are, for argument’s sake, going to accept Hamas numbers then we should also accept IDF numbers that the military has killed around 9,000 combatants (if you accept a terrorist’s numbers please have the decency to accept the democracy’s claims too). 

With those numbers, the combatant-civilian death ratio in Gaza is about 1:1.5 and less than 1:2. In other words, for every combatant killed, around 1.5 civilians are killed. 

Every loss of civilian life is tragic, but with this ratio, not only should Israel not be accused of genocide (that’s obvious), world leaders should be applauding the IDF’s precision-strike capabilities. As a point of reference, according to the UN, civilians usually make up around 90 percent of casualties in war. That’s a 1:9 ratio (one combatant for every nine civilians). 

What is happening in Gaza is unique - it is a new form of warfare (urban setting, extensive use of human shields and massive tunnel infrastructure) and still the ratio is low. 

What the IDF is doing will be studied by other militaries for decades to come. No other military in the world has ever achieved this.

Instead, a man named Attaur Rehman grabbed… https://t.co/2PccwzpQSL https://t.co/yS8nhewhCc

note_tweet.text:
At this hour at this minute on this day in the year 2002 — Jan. 23, 2002 — a young man stepped out of a car to walk into a compound on the outskirts of Karachi, Pakistan, believing he was about to do an interview with a Muslim cleric. 

Instead, a man named Attaur Rehman grabbed him and pointed a gun at his head. 

Poor, innocent Danny Pearl, then just 38, asked sincerely: “Is this security?”

Security, he thought for the sheikh. 

No, dear Danny, this was an abduction in a scheme by this deluded militant, Omar Sheikh, just 28. 

It was an operation in which you were a “target of opportunity,” but I will explain this to you tomorrow when I share how we discovered how you had been trapped.

For now, I will explain what you didn’t know — none of us knew — when you left my house on Zamzama Street hours earlier, a family of parrots squawking overhead.

You were on the hunt to find the man who was the local facilitator in Pakistan for Richard Reid, the “shoe bomber.” Farah Stockman, now at the New York Times, reported in the Boston Globe that it was this Sheikh Gilani. You were chasing the story, and Farah, to this day, regrets she got the story wrong. I regret it too. Those are the mistakes that happen. 

You were trying to talk to Gilani directly. In this hour, your wife Mariane knew something was wrong. You didn’t answer your phone.

You always answered your phone. They took your phone. They chained you to a car engine. The guards later told the police you were confused. 

They took your clothes. They brought you a 1970s warmup jacket and made you change into it. You were confused. 

Oh poor dear Danny. We are in that compound with you, although the years have passed and you are not there anymore. We are with you, dear friend. Now and always. 

This is the photo they sent of you. I want to ask the world: can you see Danny’s middle finger at his terrorists? That is the message that I received. 

Fight the jerks, the militants, the extremists, the terrorists. 

Show them the middle finger. Defeat them with will power, intellect and heart.

You, Danny, could not do so in body, but I know you are with us, Danny, in spirit, so we can prevail to know the world you were always trying to both realize and celebrate.  

Take Danny’s symbolic gesture with you, friends, real or imagined, to give yourself courage and determination. It has fueled me for the 21 years since, and we will use our courage to defeat the ideology and hate that seized this innocent man from the streets. For Danny.

xoxo
